comment.body: @Freeperson: Probably not because there are terms of use and other legal disclaimers.
@Pigpog: also "safer" is relative and not legally binding or whatever

@FraYoshi: individual posts do not get their own files, so a symlink wouldn't be applicable.
PS: there is a sym/hardlinking utility available for windows

More realistically, posts could have a new markdown syntax where the post's permalink is put. This could show up on the client like an embed.

One issue with this method is cross-hub posts. Not everyone uses the same hubs, so some permalinks may not be available to them.

Other than that, i love FraYoshi's idea of a filter to hide reposts, especially with how slow content here can be. I dont wanna see the same post 15 times!
Do you have tor configured to run as a proxy?
@Deliriumgoddess6: you need to configure zeronet to use tor, not your browser
